templates.name: Generic Java JMXMP
templates.description: Generated by official Zabbix template tool "Templator"

items.name: ClassLoading: Loaded class count
items.description: Displays number of classes that are currently loaded in the Java virtual machine.

items.name: ClassLoading: Total loaded class count
items.description: Displays the total number of classes that have been loaded since the Java virtual machine has started execution.

items.name: ClassLoading: Unloaded class count
items.description: Displays the total number of classes that have been loaded since the Java virtual machine has started execution.

items.name: Compilation: Name of the current JIT compiler
items.description: Displays the total number of classes unloaded since the Java virtual machine has started execution.

triggers.name: Generic Java JMX: Compilation: {HOST.NAME} uses suboptimal JIT compiler

items.name: Compilation: Accumulated time spent
items.description: Displays the approximate accumulated elapsed time spent in compilation, in seconds.

items.name: Memory: Heap memory committed
items.description: Current heap memory allocated. This amount of memory is guaranteed for the Java virtual machine to use.

items.name: Memory: Heap memory maximum size
items.description:
Maximum amount of heap that can be used for memory management. This amount of memory is not guaranteed to be available if it is greater than the amount of committed memory. The Java virtual machine may fail to allocate memory even if the amount of used memory does not exceed this maximum size.

service:jmx:jmxmp://{HOST.CONN}:{HOST.PORT}

items.name: Memory: Heap memory used
items.description: Current memory usage outside the heap.

items.name: Memory: Non-Heap memory committed
items.description: Current memory allocated outside the heap. This amount of memory is guaranteed for the Java virtual machine to use.

items.name: Memory: Non-Heap memory maximum size
items.description: Maximum amount of non-heap memory that can be used for memory management. This amount of memory is not guaranteed to be available if it is greater than the amount of committed memory. The Java virtual machine may fail to allocate memory even if the amount of used memory does not exceed this maximum size.

items.name: Memory: Non-Heap memory used
items.description: Current memory usage outside the heap

items.name: Memory: Object pending finalization count
items.description: The approximate number of objects for which finalization is pending.

items.name: OperatingSystem: File descriptors maximum count
items.description: This is the number of file descriptors we can have opened in the same process, as determined by the operating system. You can never have more file descriptors than this number.

items.name: OperatingSystem: File descriptors opened
items.description: This is the number of opened file descriptors at the moment, if this reaches the MaxFileDescriptorCount, the application will throw an IOException: Too many open files. This could mean you are opening file descriptors and never closing them.

items.name: OperatingSystem: Process CPU Load
items.description: ProcessCpuLoad represents the CPU load in this process.

triggers.name: Generic Java JMX: OperatingSystem: Process CPU Load is high
triggers.event_name: Generic Java JMX: OperatingSystem: Process CPU Load more than {$JMX.CPU.LOAD.MAX}% for {$JMX.CPU.LOAD.TIME}

triggers.name: Generic Java JMX: Runtime: JVM is not reachable
Generic Java JMX: Runtime: {HOST.NAME} runs suboptimal VM type

items.name: Threading: Peak thread count
items.description: Maximum number of threads being executed at the same time since the JVM was started or the peak was reset.

items.name: Threading: Thread count
items.description: The number of threads running at the current moment.

items.name: Threading: Total started thread count
items.description: The number of threads started since the JVM was launched.

item_prototypes.name: GarbageCollector: {#JMXNAME} number of collections per second
item_prototypes.description: Displays the total number of collections that have occurred per second.

item_prototypes.name: GarbageCollector: {#JMXNAME} accumulated time spent in collection
item_prototypes.description: Displays the approximate accumulated collection elapsed time, in seconds.

graph_prototypes.name: GarbageCollector: Garbage Collector {#JMXNAME} collections per second

item_prototypes.name: Memory pool: {#JMXNAME} maximum size
item_prototypes.description: Maximum amount of memory that can be used for memory management. This amount of memory is not guaranteed to be available if it is greater than the amount of committed memory. The Java virtual machine may fail to allocate memory even if the amount of used memory does not exceed this maximum size.

trigger_prototypes.expression: min(/Generic Java JMXMP/jmx["java.lang:name={#JMXNAME},type=MemoryPool","Usage.used"],{$JMX.MP.USAGE.TIME:"{#JMXNAME}"})>(last(/Generic Java JMXMP/jmx["java.lang:name={#JMXNAME},type=MemoryPool","Usage.max"])*{$JMX.MP.USAGE.MAX:"{#JMXNAME}"}/100) and last(/Generic Java JMXMP/jmx["java.lang:name={#JMXNAME},type=MemoryPool","Usage.max"])>0
trigger_prototypes.name: Generic Java JMX: Memory pool: {#JMXNAME} memory usage is high
trigger_prototypes.event_name: Generic Java JMX: Memory pool: {#JMXNAME} memory usage more than {$JMX.MP.USAGE.MAX:"{#JMXNAME}"}% for {$JMX.MP.USAGE.TIME:"{#JMXNAME}"}

macros.description: A threshold in percent for CPU utilization trigger.
The time during which the CPU utilization may exceed the threshold.
A threshold in percent for file descriptors count trigger.
The time during which the file descriptors count may exceed the threshold.
A threshold in percent for Heap memory utilization trigger.
The time during which the Heap memory utilization may exceed the threshold.
This macro used in memory pool discovery as a filter.
A threshold in percent for memory pools utilization trigger. Use a context to change the threshold for a specific pool.
The time during which the memory pools utilization may exceed the threshold.
A threshold in percent for Non-heap memory utilization trigger.
The time during which the Non-heap memory utilization may exceed the threshold.

value.name: GarbageCollector: Garbage Collector {#JMXNAME} collections per second

triggers.expression: min(/Generic Java JMXMP/jmx["java.lang:type=Memory","HeapMemoryUsage.used"],{$JMX.HEAP.MEM.USAGE.TIME})>(last(/Generic Java JMXMP/jmx["java.lang:type=Memory","HeapMemoryUsage.max"])*{$JMX.HEAP.MEM.USAGE.MAX}/100) and last(/Generic Java JMXMP/jmx["java.lang:type=Memory","HeapMemoryUsage.max"])>0
triggers.name: Generic Java JMX: Memory: Heap memory usage is high
triggers.event_name: Generic Java JMX: Memory: Heap memory usage more than {$JMX.HEAP.USAGE.MAX}% for {$JMX.HEAP.MEM.USAGE.TIME}

triggers.expression: min(/Generic Java JMXMP/jmx["java.lang:type=Memory","NonHeapMemoryUsage.used"],{$JMX.NONHEAP.MEM.USAGE.TIME})>(last(/Generic Java JMXMP/jmx["java.lang:type=Memory","NonHeapMemoryUsage.max"])*{$JMX.NONHEAP.MEM.USAGE.MAX}/100) and last(/Generic Java JMXMP/jmx["java.lang:type=Memory","NonHeapMemoryUsage.max"])>0
triggers.name: Generic Java JMX: Memory: Non-Heap memory usage is high
triggers.event_name: Generic Java JMX: Memory: Non-Heap memory usage more than {$JMX.NONHEAP.MEM.USAGE.MAX}% for {$JMX.NONHEAP.MEM.USAGE.TIME}

triggers.name: Generic Java JMX: OperatingSystem: Opened file descriptor count is high
triggers.event_name: Generic Java JMX: OperatingSystem: Opened file descriptor count more than {$JMX.FILE.DESCRIPTORS.MAX}% of maximum
